intro: Melampyrum laxum f. australe, commonly known as the Australian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. This variety is a smaller form of the species, with shorter stems and smaller flowers compared to the typical form.
